snippet: A teenager charged with killing a Utah soccer referee during a game pleaded guilty to a charge of homicide by assault.
abstract: Teenager who punched Utah soccer referee Ricardo Portillo once in the head during a match on April 27, accidentally killing him, pleads guilty to a charge of homicide by assault, and is sentenced to juvenile prison; other soccer news noted.
lead_paragraph: A teenager charged with killing a Utah soccer referee during a game pleaded guilty to a charge of homicide by assault.

headline.main: Teenager Pleads Guilty in Utah Referee’s Death
